George A. Romero is a master of blending suspense and intrigue, so I think you'd really enjoy "White Night" (2007). It's a gripping mystery that unfolds at a slow burn, much like some of his classic horror films. The plot twists and turns will keep you on the edge of your seat as the lead inspector tries to solve the case.

If you're in the mood for something a bit more light-hearted, "The Whistler" (2016) is a fun and quirky tale that plays with the idea of a gentle giant defending his love against all odds. It's got a great balance of humor and action, and I think you'd find it an entertaining ride!

If you're in the mood for something more recent, "The Life Aquatic with Steve Zissou" is another great option. It's an adventure-comedy that stars Bill Murray as the titular character, who sets out to exact revenge on a legendary shark that killed his partner. The film features a fantastic cast, including Owen Wilson and Willem Dafoe, and has a unique blend of humor and heart.

I think you might enjoy "The Messenger"! It's a thought-provoking film that explores the complexities of war and human connection, with a great performance from Brendan Sexton III. The story is also emotionally charged, tackling themes of grief, love, and redemption in the face of conflict.

Alternatively, if you're looking for something a bit more intense, "Redacted" might be up your alley. Directed by the acclaimed war filmmaker, Kimberly Pierce, this film takes an unflinching look at the devastating consequences of war on innocent civilians.
